item.title: Observation of exceptional points in a spherical open elastic system
item.description: arXiv:2409.08560v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Exceptional points (EPs) are spectral singularities in non-Hermitian systems where eigenvalues and their corresponding eigenstates coalesce simultaneously. In this study, we calculate scattering poles in an open spherical solid and propose a depth-first search-based method to identify EPs. Using the proposed method, we numerically identify multiple EPs in a parameter space and confirm the simultaneous degeneracy of scattering poles through numerical experiments. The proposed method and findings enable the exploration of applications in practical three-dimension models.
item.dc:creator: Hiroaki Deguchi, Kei Matsushima, Takayuki Yamada
